The desirability of writing a covered call to enhance income depends upon the chance
that the stock price will exceed the exercise price at which the trader writes the call. In
this example, the writer of the call thinks the stock's upside potential is less than the
buyer expects. The buyer of the call is paying $4 to get any gain above $55, while the
seller has traded the upside potential above $55 for a payment of $4.
